issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.customfield_12310192: Support for hftp and hsftp has been removed.  They have superseded by webhdfs  and swebhdfs.

fields.summary: Remove hsftp from DistCp in trunk

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.summary: Update the document of hftp/hsftp in branch-2 to mention that they are deprecated

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Currently hftp / hsftp only provide a strict subset of functionality that webhdfs / swebhdfs offer. Notably, hftp / hsftp do not support writes and HA namenodes. Maintaining two piece of code with similar functionality introduce unnecessary work.

Webhdfs has been around since Hadoop 1.0 therefore moving forward with webhdfs does not seem to cause any significant migration issues.

This jira proposes to deprecate hftp / hsftp in branch-2 and remove them in trunk.
fields.summary: Deprecate hftp / hsftp and replace them with webhdfs / swebhdfs

Also, for the webUrl part, now can we generalize it to "http url of webhdfs" and "fs uri"? I think the former should be necessary (the current patch does not support it). For later if hdfs/webhdsf/swebhdfs scheme is provided we can even support HA (but this also requires extra information in the configuration). We should also document it and include it in the tool usage description.
The v8 patch addresses Jing's comments.

Discussed offline with [~jingzhao]. Since the users can easily use curl to get the delegation token through webhdfs API, the v9 patch no longer supports specifying webservice url, instead it gets the token using the RPC client. We can add this functionality back if needed.
The v10 patch removes some unused imports and dead code.

The test failure should be unrelated and it passed in my local test. +1 for the latest patch.

[~kihwal], do you also want to take a look at the patch?
Based on the +1 from [~jingzhao], I'll commit this patch to trunk tomorrow afternoon unless objections.

bq.  Since the users can easily use curl to get the delegation token through webhdfs API, the v9 patch no longer supports specifying webservice url, instead it gets the token using the RPC client. We can add this functionality back if needed.

Unless there is a strong compelling reason, please keep fetchdt compatible.
The v11 patch addresses Kihwal's comments.

I've committed the patch to trunk. Thanks [~jingzhao] and [~kihwal] for the reviews.
